channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

channel.itunes:summary: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast. http://www.npr.org/sections/science/

item.title: As India's Climate Changes, Farmers In The North Experiment With New Crops
item.description: August 20, 2017 - Farmers are starting to grow new crops in winter, when their fields usually lie fallow. Meanwhile, air pollution, which contributes to climate change, is weakening India's solar energy production.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 20, 2017 - Farmers are starting to grow new crops in winter, when their fields usually lie fallow. Meanwhile, air pollution, which contributes to climate change, is weakening India's solar energy production. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/08/20/543881831/as-indias-climate-changes-farmers-in-the-north-experiment-with-new-crops

item.title: In Turkey, Schools Will Stop Teaching Evolution This Fall
item.description: August 20, 2017 - When Turkish children head back to school, something will be missing from their textbooks: any mention of evolution. The government is phasing in what it calls a values-based curriculum.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 20, 2017 - When Turkish children head back to school, something will be missing from their textbooks: any mention of evolution. The government is phasing in what it calls a values-based curriculum. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/08/20/540965889/in-turkey-schools-will-stop-teaching-evolution-this-fall

item.title: Getting To The Core Of Exercises Said To Strengthen 'Mum Tum'
item.description: August 20, 2017 - NPR listeners had lots of questions after our story about diastasis recti, a medical condition of abdominal muscles that's common among new moms. Many wanted to know more about how to fix the problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 20, 2017 - NPR listeners had lots of questions after our story about diastasis recti, a medical condition of abdominal muscles that's common among new moms. Many wanted to know more about how to fix the problem. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/20/542424977/getting-to-the-core-of-exercises-said-to-strengthen-mum-tum

item.title: Be Smart: A Partial Eclipse Can Fry Your Naked Eyes
item.description: August 18, 2017 - And telescopes and binoculars only amplify the risk to your eyes from looking at the sun, doctors say. So even if you're not in the "path of totality," take precautions if you plan to watch.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 18, 2017 - And telescopes and binoculars only amplify the risk to your eyes from looking at the sun, doctors say. So even if you're not in the "path of totality," take precautions if you plan to watch. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/18/543745409/be-smart-a-partial-eclipse-can-fry-your-naked-eyes

item.title: Is AI More Threatening Than North Korean Missiles?
item.description: August 18, 2017 - Tesla CEO Elon Musk last week warned that AI is an enormous threat. There can be no doubt that the advent of smart, rather than smart-ish, machines, is a long way off, though, says blogger Alva NoÃ«.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 18, 2017 - Tesla CEO Elon Musk last week warned that AI is an enormous threat. There can be no doubt that the advent of smart, rather than smart-ish, machines, is a long way off, though, says blogger Alva NoÃ«. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/18/544061771/is-ai-more-threatening-than-north-korean-missiles

item.title: Exclusive: Inside The Lab Where Scientists Are Editing DNA In Human Embryos
item.description: August 18, 2017 - NPR gets exclusive access to a lab in Portland, Ore., where scientists have begun editing the DNA in human embryos to try to prevent genetic diseases.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 18, 2017 - NPR gets exclusive access to a lab in Portland, Ore., where scientists have begun editing the DNA in human embryos to try to prevent genetic diseases. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/18/543769759/a-first-look-inside-the-lab-where-scientists-are-editing-dna-in-human-embryos

item.title: California Prepares For An Eclipse Of Its Solar Power
item.description: August 18, 2017 - On a sunny day, California gets up to 40 percent of its energy from solar power. Monday's total eclipse isn't just a scientific spectacle, it's a major concern for the state's power grid.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 18, 2017 - On a sunny day, California gets up to 40 percent of its energy from solar power. Monday's total eclipse isn't just a scientific spectacle, it's a major concern for the state's power grid. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/18/543462652/california-prepares-for-an-eclipse-of-its-solar-power

item.title: Will The Eclipse Make Crops And Animals Flip Out? Scientists Ask (Really)
item.description: August 17, 2017 - During the day on Aug. 21, large swaths of farmland will be plunged into darkness, and temperatures will drop about 10 degrees. And scientists are waiting to see what happens on the ground.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 17, 2017 - During the day on Aug. 21, large swaths of farmland will be plunged into darkness, and temperatures will drop about 10 degrees. And scientists are waiting to see what happens on the ground. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/17/543741919/will-the-eclipse-make-crops-and-animals-flip-out-scientists-ask-really

item.title: Bears Can Face Summer Challenges In Roadside Zoos
item.description: August 17, 2017 - Even when the Animal Welfare Act is followed, bears may not live in conditions that many would find reasonable for such large, intelligent animals to flourish, says anthropologist Barbara J. King.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 17, 2017 - Even when the Animal Welfare Act is followed, bears may not live in conditions that many would find reasonable for such large, intelligent animals to flourish, says anthropologist Barbara J. King. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/17/543682389/bears-can-face-summer-challenges-in-roadside-zoos

item.title: Chemists Say You Should Add A Little Water To Your Whiskey. Here's Why
item.description: August 17, 2017 - It's a common refrain from whiskey enthusiasts: Adding a few drops of water to a glass opens up the flavors of the drink. Chemists in Sweden provide a molecular explanation for why this works.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 17, 2017 - It's a common refrain from whiskey enthusiasts: Adding a few drops of water to a glass opens up the flavors of the drink. Chemists in Sweden provide a molecular explanation for why this works. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/17/543902701/chemists-say-you-should-add-a-little-water-to-your-whisky-here-s-why

item.title: Rituals To Sprinkle A Little Magic Into Your Eclipse Experience
item.description:
August 17, 2017 - A slightly witch-y mother, an astrologer, and the co-writer of a guide for Basic Witches share their eclipse rituals.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/17/543634260/rituals-to-sprinkle-a-little-magic-into-your-eclipse-experience

item.title: Make Your Own Eclipse Viewer
item.description:
August 17, 2017 - No eclipse glasses? No problem. Make your own solar viewer; (almost) no tools required.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/17/543633362/make-your-own-eclipse-viewer

item.title: Probiotic Bacteria Could Protect Newborns From Deadly Infection
item.description: August 16, 2017 - Each year more than 600,000 babies die of sepsis. Researchers have found a simple way to prevent it: Feed babies probiotic bacteria that are common in kimchi, pickles and other fermented vegetables.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - Each year more than 600,000 babies die of sepsis. Researchers have found a simple way to prevent it: Feed babies probiotic bacteria that are common in kimchi, pickles and other fermented vegetables. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/16/543920822/probiotic-bacteria-could-protect-newborns-from-deadly-infection

item.title: With Heavy Drinking On The Rise, How Much Is Too Much?
item.description: August 16, 2017 - Binge-drinking sounds like an all-night bender, but here's a reality check: Many social drinkers may "binge" without knowing it. Women who drink four or more drinks on an occasion are binge-drinking.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - Binge-drinking sounds like an all-night bender, but here's a reality check: Many social drinkers may "binge" without knowing it. Women who drink four or more drinks on an occasion are binge-drinking. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/16/543965637/women-who-love-wine-are-you-binge-drinking-without-realizing-it

item.title: Trump Rolls Back Obama-Era Flood Standards For Infrastructure Projects
item.description: August 16, 2017 - An Obama order called for new public infrastructure projects to be built to withstand rising sea levels caused by climate change. President Trump revoked that order to accelerate the review process.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - An Obama order called for new public infrastructure projects to be built to withstand rising sea levels caused by climate change. President Trump revoked that order to accelerate the review process. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/16/543712263/trump-rolls-back-obama-era-flood-standards-for-infrastructure-projects
